newsitem.title: EGYPT: Cairo Precision details share allocation.
newsitem.headline: Cairo Precision details share allocation.

text.p: The Egyptian family-owned Olympic Electric Group said on Sunday that each applicant for shares in its Cairo Precision Industries would get 8.8 percent of what he asked for with a minimum of two shares per application.
Final figures showed that the share offer in the water heater manufacturer was 11.4 times oversubscribed, the group said in a published advertisement.
The offer, of 300,000 new shares at a fixed price of 85.00 pounds ($25) a share, has closed after the statutory minimum period of 10 days earlier this month.
Cairo Precision is one of the first Egyptian so-called "closed" companies to open up to the public through a share issue on the stock exchange.
The share issue will cut the stake of the parent company, Olympic Electric, to about 52 percent from 62 percent.
Other parties, including mutual funds and banks, previously held about 570,000 of the original 1.5 million shares.
Cairo Precision has forecast that its net profits will increase to 19.046 million pounds in 1997 from 15.931 million in 1996.
A group official said last month that profits were 14.755 million pounds in 1995.
